clinical_study.brief_title: Innovative Pulmonary Rehabilitation Telehealth Program for Improving COPD Patient Outcomes
clinical_study.official_title: Innovative Pulmonary Rehabilitation Telehealth Program for Improving COPD Patient Outcomes

brief_summary.textblock: Researchers want to learn more about telehealth pulmonary rehabilitation programs that help people with Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) improve physical activity and quality of life.

primary_outcome.description: Changes will be measured using the Yale Physical Activity Survey (YPAS). The tool is composed of two sections - (a) amount of physical activity/exercise performed during a typical week in the past month and (b) activities performed in the past month. The final index score is the sum of five individual indices (vigorous, leisurely walking, moving, standing and sitting). Scores on the scale range from 0 to 137. The higher the score the more active a person.

secondary_outcome.description: The COPD Assessment Test (CAT) will be used to measure the health status of the subjects. The test has eight questions. Each question has a range from 0-5. The total score for the test ranges from 0 to 40. The higher the score the more severe a person's COPD.
Assessed adherence to physical activity measured by the proportion of weeks subjects achieve their planned physical activity time.

arm_group.description: Participants will take part in a structured telehealth program for 12 weeks. Web-based educational tools will be made available to participants. Study participants will meet with a registered respiratory therapist two times per week.

intervention.description: Telehealth program delivered remotely to study participants. Program developed by Cambium Technologies.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hospital discharge diagnosis of COPD
- Spirometry-confirmed evidence of COPD Global Initiative for Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease (GOLD) stages I to IV
- Access to internet connection and knowledge on use of web-based programs
Exclusion Criteria:
- Persons with additional significant comorbidities including cancer, cardiac disease and physical impairments
- Non-English speaking persons
- The inability to provide an informed consent
